message.name: ACC_LINK_TOOLTIP
message.text:
Select the node to which the accessory page is attached and then select the accessory page you would like to link to.

Note that you can only link to accessory pages that are attached to containing groups of the current group. If you would like to have an accessory page linked from the pages of a set of groups but not to the page of the groups' containing group, attach it to the containing group and then deselect the box in the Show column of the Accessory Pages list.

message.name: ACC_PAGES_TOOLTIP
message.text:
Use accessory pages to accommodate content that won't fit on ToL branch and leaf pages. Links to accessory pages will be available in the Extras menu of the branch or leaf page that the accessory page is attached to.

Use the Add button to create new accessory pages or new links to accessory pages that are already attached to another ToL branch page. Use the Delete button to get rid of an accessory page.

message.name: ACTION_DELETE_UNDELETABLE_NODE
message.text: <html> 100. Sorry, can't let you do that. This would cause the node for the containing group to be deleted. However, that node has information attached to it (e.g., a page), which protects it from being deleted without further consideration. You can make the containing group node deletable by first deleting the objects attached to it, or by moving them to other nodes. </html>

message.name: ADD_IMAGE_TOOLTIP
message.text:
To add an image to one of your text sections, put the cursor in the position where you want the image to be shown and click the Add Image button. You will then be able to select an image to be displayed in the specified position.

In order for images to be available for selection, they first need to be added to the Images Pool for this branch. You can do this in the Images Window, which is available from the Window menu.

message.name: ANCESTOR_NOT_UPLOADED
message.text:
101. You need to upload $%ancestor_name%$
before being able to upload the ($%node_name%$) subtree.

message.name: APPLICATION_CLOSE
message.text:
102. Oh My! An unknown error occurred.
To prevent further errors, please close TreeGrow and open it again.
If this doesn't solve the problem, please send a bug report to treegrow@tolweb.org
describing the circumstances under which it occurs.

message.name: APPROVAL_PENDING
message.text: 103. This branch has beem submitted for publication. It cannot be downloaded until it is released by the reviewing editor.

message.name: APPROVAL_PENDING_EDITING_PRIVILEGES
message.text: 104. This branch has been submitted to you for publication. Please review and publish or request revisions from the authors.

message.name: ATTACH_ERROR
message.text:
105. There was a problem attaching the image.
Sometimes it helps to close a window, reopen it, and then try again.
Closing and reopening TreeGrow may also fix the problem.
If this error persists, please send a bug report to treegrow@tolweb.org
describing the circumstances under which it occurs.

message.name: ATTACH_SUCCESSFUL
message.text: <html>106. The image has been attached.</html>

message.name: BAD_FILE_UPLOAD
message.text:
107. The file you are trying to open is out of date.
You may have a newer version on another computer.
In order to edit this branch, you need to find the newer version,
or simply download the current version from the server.

message.name: BAD_PASSWORD
message.text: 108. There's something wrong with your password. Please contact treegrow@tolweb.org for assistance.

message.name: CANCEL_NO_CHECKIN
message.text: 109. I'll check in later, thanks

message.name: CANCEL_NO_SUBMIT
message.text: 110. Cancel and don't upload

message.name: CANT_CHECK_IN
message.text:
111. There was a problem checking in the branch.
Please close TreeGrow, restart it, and then try again.
If this doesn't solve the problem, please send a bug report to treegrow@tolweb.org
describing the circumstances under which it occurs.

message.name: CANT_CONFIRM_CURR_VER
message.text:
112. TreeGrow usually connects to the ToL Database to make sure
the files you are working on are up to date.
Since there is no network connection, this check cannot be performed.
If you are sure you don't have newer versions on another computer, it's safe to continue.
Do you wish to continue?

message.name: CHANGE_PASSWORDS_NO_MATCH
message.text: <html> 299. The new passwords you have entered do not match. Please check your typing and try again</html>

message.name: CHECKIN_ERROR
message.text:
113. There was a problem checking in the branch.
Please close TreeGrow, restart it, and then try again.
If this doesn't solve the problem, please send a bug report to treegrow@tolweb.org
describing the circumstances under which it occurs.

message.name: CHECKIN_NO_UPLOAD
message.text: 114. Don't upload recent changes, just check in the file. (Note: changes that have not been uploaded will be lost.)

message.name: CHECKIN_SUBTREE_NO_UPLOAD
message.text:
116. Don't upload recent changes, just check in the subtree.
(Note: changes that have not been uploaded will be lost.)

message.name: CHECKIN_SUCCESS
message.text: <html> 117. $%group%$ checked in. Thank you!</html>

message.name: CHECK_IN_CHANGES
message.text: <html> 118. Do you want to check in the file?</html>

message.name: CHKD_BY_ELSE
message.text:
119. This branch has been checked out by $%user%$ on $%time%$.
This branch cannot be downloaded until it is checked back in.

message.name: CHKD_BY_U_INTERNAL
message.text:
120. This node is included in your download of the $%nodename%$ branch at depth $%depth%$.
You need to check in $%nodename%$ before you can download this subtree by itself.

message.name: CHK_UPLOAD_CHNGS
message.text: 121. Do you want to upload the changes and check in the file?

message.name: CHOOSE_FILE_NAME
message.text: 122. Please choose a file name

message.name: CONFIDENCE_TOOLTIP
message.text:
If you select incertae sedis in putative position, the branch leading to the node will be marked with a question mark on the ToL page for the containing group.

If you select incertae sedis position unspecified, the group will be clipped from its position and shown below the tree on the ToL page for the containing group.

Please note that incertae sedis position unspecified nodes are subject to restrictions with respect to their position in the tree. This is because they are not truly part of the tree structure but are placed in a given position only provisionally. Since such nodes are not valid descendents of their provisional parent nodes, incertae sedis position unspecified nodes cannot be part of a dichotomy, i.e., they always need to have at least two sibling nodes.

message.name: CONTRIBUTORS_ASSIGNMENT_TOOLTIP
message.text:
Contributors should be assigned to the group to which they are expected to contribute. You can assign contributors to any node within your realm of authority. If you would like to have a person assigned to a node for which you do not have assignment privileges, please send a request to
treegrow@tolweb.org, and we will take care of it for you.

By default, TreeGrow will assign the basal node of the current download to any new contributors you add to the ToL database. You can then adjust group assignments as needed.

A group assignment will provide a person with the privilege to download and edit the assigned node and its descendants, as well as making group assignments to other people within their realm of authority. Group assignments should therefore be made only for ToL authors and coordinators and not for contributors of other materials like images and other media.

message.name: CONTRIBUTORS_CONTACT_TOOLTIP
message.text:
We usually print the address of ToL page authors at the bottom of the page. If you would rather not have your address published, you can select Do not print on web pages, and we will then only print the name of your Institution as entered in the Institution field.

We encourage ToL page authors to provide their e-mail addresses, so people can contact them if they have questions about their work. We now implement javascript-mediated obfuscation of e-mail addresses when they are printed on ToL pages, so spammers will have a hard time harvesting e-mail addresses from the ToL site. If you do not want your e-mail address to be printed on ToL pages at all, you can select Do not print on web pages, and we will honor your request.

message.name: CONTRIBUTORS_WINDOW_TOOLTIP
message.text:
This window provides an overview of all the people that are potential contributors to the nodes included in the current download. It includes authors of pages attached to the nodes as well as coordinators for containing groups all the way down to Life on Earth. In addition, images-only contributors are listed here, at least for the time being.

You can add additional contributors to this Contributor Pool either by establishing a new entry for a person who is not yet in the ToL contributors database (Enter New Contributor), or you can fetch registered ToL contributors from the ToL Database (Fetch Contributor from Database). You will need a network connection to do the latter.

Once a contributor has been added to the Contributor Pool, you will be able to simply select this person as a contributor in a variety of different places, e.g., as page authors or as copyright owners.

Any contributors you add will remain in this Contributor Pool as long as you have the current branch downloaded. However, when you check in the branch, the Contributor Pool will be reset to contain only people who are assigned to nodes in a given branch or who are already selected as contributors of materials attached to nodes in the branch.

message.name: CONTRIBUTOR_INFO_NEEDED
message.text: <html> 295. Please choose a copyright owner from the list or enter Copyright Holder information manually.</html>

message.name: COULDNT_PUSH_PUBLIC
message.text:
123. There was a problem publishing this branch.
Please restart the application and try again.

message.name: COULDNT_REVERT
message.text:
124. Cannot revert.
Please restart the application and try again.

message.name: DELETE_LINKED_ACCESSORY_PAGES
message.text:
115. Other ToL pages contain links to the accessory page you want to delete.
If you delete the page here, all of these links will be removed.
Are you sure you want to do this?

message.name: DELETE_NODE_OK
message.text: <html> 125. Is it ok to delete the node $%nodename%$?</html>

message.name: DESCRIPTION_TOOLTIP
message.text: Text entered in the Description field will be printed as a comment after the taxon name in the tree or taxon list of the page of the containing group. So keep it short!

message.name: DESCRIPTION_TOOLTIP_NOPAGE
message.text: <html><table width="100%"><td width="500">Descriptions will currently be printed only if a node has a page attached to it.

message.name: DIFF_VER_STILL_DOWNLOAD
message.text:
126. Our records show that you have downloaded this branch previously,
but we cannot find the file on your computer.
If you don't have a newer version on another computer,
it's safe to simply download the current version from the server.
Do you want to download?.

message.name: DOWNLOADING_NEW_VERSION
message.text: 298. Downloading the new version of TreeGrow. Please be patient as this may take a while.

message.name: DOWNLOAD_AGAIN
message.text:
127. An error occurred during the download.
There may have been hickups in the network.
Would you like to try again?

message.name: DOWNLOAD_TOOLTIP_LOCAL
message.text: To begin working on your branch open a file in the Local files panel, or download a new branch from the ToL Database. To initiate the download, please type the name of the group you want to work on in the field above, and then click on the Find Group button. Then select the group you want to download from the list of names displayed in the box on the left and click on the Download button. By default, only the basal page for your group will be downloaded. If there are additional pages you want to download, you can increase the Page depth or you can use the Fetch Subgroup tool in the Tree Window.

message.name: DOWNLOAD_TOOLTIP_NO_LOCAL
message.text:
To begin working on your branch you need to download the associated materials from the ToL Database.

Please type the name of the group you want to work on in the field above, and then click on the Find Group button.

Then select the group you want to download from the list of names displayed in the box on the left and click on the Download button.

By default, only the basal page for your group will be downloaded. If there are additional pages you want to download, you can increase the Page depth below, or you can use the Fetch Subgroup tool in the Tree Window.

message.name: EDIT_CONTRIBUTORS_TOOLTIP
message.text:
This panel lets you edit data for individual contributors. In order to edit the data, you first need to check them out from the ToL database by clicking on the Edit Contributor Data button (you need a network connection to do this). When you are done editing a person's data, please check them back in.

You will be able to edit the data for any contributor assigned to a node within your realm of authority. However, we ask that you please not edit other people's data without their explicit permission.

message.name: ERROR_CHK_LOG
message.text:
128. Error Occured. Please close TreeGrow, restart it, and then try again.
If this doesn't solve the problem, please send a bug report to treegrow@tolweb.org
describing the circumstances under which it occurs.
Tell them there may be more information in the LogFile.

message.name: ERROR_NEW_VERSION
message.text:
129. There was an error downloading the new version of the application.
Don't worry about it now, the application will continue to run normally with the old version.
Try updating later.

message.name: ERROR_NEW_VERSION_CANT_RENAME
message.text:
130. There was an error downloading the new version of the application.
There may have been hickups in the network. Try downloading again later.
The application should continue to run normally with the old version.
If it won't start up, please do the following:
  • If all your recent changes have been uploaded to the ToL server,
    simply download the new version of TreeGrow manually from
    http://tolweb.org/tree/sep/mcacquire.html
    then download your branches from the ToL server.
  • If there are changes in files on your computer that have not yet been uploaded to the ToL server,
    please contact treegrow@tolweb.org for instructions on how to update without losing your changes.

message.name: ERROR_SEARCH
message.text: <html> 300. There was an error searching the image database. Please contact treegrow@ag.arizona.edu for assistance.

message.name: ERROR_UPLOAD_TREE
message.text: <html> 131. Error uploading the branch. $%message%$ please contact treegrow@tolweb.org before doing any more work with this file.</html>

message.name: ERROR_WRITE_FILE
message.text: 132. There was a problem writing the file to disk. Please try again or choose another filename.

message.name: EXPORT_DOWNLOAD
message.text: <html> 133. Export this file and then download the current version from the server?</html>

message.name: EXPORT_MOVE_RECYCLE
message.text:
134. Export this file and then move it to the recycle bin.
If you want to continue working on this branch, you will need to download the version from the server.
Please contact treegrow@tolweb.org for assistance in recovering lost changes from the recycled file.

message.name: FIRST_TIME_TOOLTIP
message.text:
When you download a branch of the Tree of Life, the data
associated with this branch will be stored in a series of files
on your computer. These files are then modified by TreeGrow
as you develop new content for the downloaded group.

Note that there is no Save option in TreeGrow's File menu.
This is because any changes you make are immediately
saved to the relevant files on your computer. In order to have
these changes reflected in the ToL Database, you will then
periodically upload the revised files to the ToL server.

When you are ready to publish your work or to have it looked
at by a ToL editor, go to the Upload, preview, submit panel
of the TreeGrow Manager. There you will find a listing of all the
ToL pages affected by your revisions and a menu that will allow
you to submit these pages to a ToL editor.

message.name: FOUR_DIGIT_DATE
message.text: <html> 135. The date must be a positive 4-digit number</html>

message.name: HANDBACK_ERROR
message.text:
136. There was a problem checking in the branch.
Please try again.

message.name: IMAGES_WINDOW_TOOLTIP
message.text:
This window provides an overview of all the images that are attached to a node in the current download or that are used on a page attached to a node in the current download. You can edit data for an image either here or in the Images Panel of the Node Data Window for the node that the image is attached to.

Why do we have this alternative handling of images in the Images Window on the one hand and the Images Panels on the other? The Images Window is meant to be the central place for working with images for the downloaded branch and for editing image data; while the Images Panel of the Node Data Window is meant to give an overview of those images that are relevant specifically to one particular node. The significance of the Images Panels for individual nodes will become increasingly important as we add more images to the ToL database not specifically for use on ToL pages, but for retrieval in phylogenetically structured queries to serve a variety of purposes.

message.name: IMAGE_ATTACHMENT_TOOLTIP
message.text:
When adding new images to the ToL Database, we ask that you attach them to the most specific node possible; i.e., if you have an image of a specimen of a certain species and the node for this species is represented in the ToL database, you should attach it to the species node, even if you are going to use the image as a title illustration on the branch page for the order or the family. This means that many ToL images will not be attached to a given node, although they may be used as illustrations on a page attached to this node.

Why are we handling image attachments in this way? It is our goal to impose phylogenetic structure upon the ToL image collection, so that we can query the ToL image database for images attached to a particular set of nodes; e.g., we could ask for all the images that are attached to the Tyrannosauridae node and its descendants. If an image of a Tyrannosaurus was attached to the Dinosauria page, it wouldn't get picked up in such a query. Developing the phylogenetic structure of the ToL image database will long be a work in progress. Since the ToL started out without any attachment data associated with image files, we still have much clean-up work to do, and we would appreciate your help in attaching your own images to the proper nodes. For the time being, we have attached most images to the nodes of the pages they are attached to since we could easily do this automatically.

message.name: IMAGE_CAPTION_TOOLTIP
message.text:
Page authors have the option to automatically compile the data stored with images into a caption, or they can write a Custom Caption themselves. In many cases, the best solution will be a mixed format, with a brief custom caption giving general information about the image array, followed by a listing of the Image Data.

The display of the two components is controlled by two check boxes, which are both checked by default. Below the Custom Caption text field, there's a crude preview of the caption as it is going to be shown on the ToL page. Note that the image copyright data are always going to get printed, even if you deselect the Print Image Data option. This means that you need not include any copyright information in your Custom Caption.

message.name: IMAGE_CHECKED_OUT
message.text:
137. The object was checked out
  • by $%username%$ ($%email%$)
  • at $%datetime%$
You won't be able to edit the associated data until it has been checked back in.

message.name: IMG_DIR_ERROR
message.text: <html> 138. Error occured trying to create the directory $%dir%$</html>

message.name: IMPORTANT_NAMES_TOOLTIP
message.text: Important Names:If you check one or more boxes in the Important Names column, the associated names will be printed in the subtitle of your ToL page.

message.name: IMPORTANT_NAMES_TOOLTIP_NOPAGE
message.text:
Important Names:

You can check one or more boxes in this column to designate the associated names as Important Names. Important Names are printed as subtitles if there is a page attached to a node. If there's no page attached, we currently just store the Important Names values for future use.

message.name: INTERNAL_NODE
message.text:
139. Currently, the basal node of a download needs to have a page attached to it.
TreeGrow will download the requested node by downloading the branch for the nearest page-carrying containing group, $%ancestor_name%$.

message.name: INTERNETLINKS_TOOLTIP
message.text: Please use HTML to format your list of Internet Links. If you need instructions, please have a look at the All the HTML You Will Likely Need page in the ToL Contributors Documentation.

message.name: INVALID_DATE
message.text: <html> 140. Date must be a positive 4-digit number.</html>

message.name: IN_TREE-APPROVAL_PENDING
message.text:
141. This branch has beem submitted for publication.
It cannot be downloaded until it is released by the reviewing editor.

message.name: IN_TREE-CHKD_BY_ELSE
message.text: 142. This node has been checked out by $%user%$ on $%time%$. It cannot be downloaded until it is checked back in.

message.name: ISPU_INCONSISTENT
message.text:
143. Can't do what you are trying to do, because it would adversely affect
the placement of a node that is Incertae Sedis Position Unspecified.
Such nodes are subject to restrictions with respect to their position in the tree,
because they are not truly part of the tree structure
but are placed in a given position only provisionally.
One of the restrictions is that they cannot be part of a dichotomy,
i.e., an Incertae Sedis Position Unspecified node needs to have at least two sibling nodes.
In order to achieve the desired tree structure, you need to
set the property of the node to Incertae Sedis In Putative Position.

message.name: JUST_CLOSE_FILE
message.text: 144. Just close the file.

message.name: LABEL_TOOLTIP
message.text:
Preferred Labels:

If you check one or more boxes in the Preferred Labels column, the associated names will be printed in the supertitle of your ToL page, i.e., above the node name. Also, the first of the selected Preferred Labels will be used instead of the node name in the tree or taxon list of the containing group.

message.name: LABEL_TOOLTIP_NOPAGE
message.text:
Preferred Labels:

Selecting Preferred Labels usually has an effect> on ToL page display only if a node has a page attached to it. There is one exception to this: when the containing group of an internal node has a taxon list displayed rather than a tree, the Preferred Label will be printed along with the node name, and the node name will be indented with respect to the Preferred Label, e.g.:
Monotypicfamiliidae (the Preferred Labels)     Monotypicfamilia monotypicus (the node name)

message.name: LAST_PERMISSION_NO_DELETE
message.text:
Deleting the last permission in your list of permissions would lock you out of TreeGrow.
Please add another permission for yourself if you want to remove this one.

message.name: LINK_TOOLTIP
message.text:
A ToL accessory page can be attached to more than one node. For example, a page that contains an index of all the species in a group may be attached to all of the branch and leaf pages within this group.

Check the box in the Link column if you want to add to the Extras menu a link to an accessory page that is already attached to another ToL branch page. You will then be able to select from a list of accessory pages that are attached to the current group's containing groups.

message.name: LINK_TO_UNUPLOADED_ACC
message.text:
254. You cannot upload the selected subtree because it links to
an accessory page that has not yet been uploaded.
You first need to upload the node to which the linked accessory page is attached.
The easiest thing is to just upload the whole branch.

message.name: LINK_TO_UNUPLOADED_PAGE
message.text:
255. You can't upload the selected subtree
because there's a containing group node
that has not yet been uploaded.
Please upload the subtree that contains the containing group node.

message.name: LOCAL_FILES_TOOLTIP_CONN
message.text:
In order to access one of the branches you have downloaded from the ToL Database, you can double-click on it in the list above. If you want to download additional branches, you can do so in the Download from server panel.

Note: Branches you have downloaded from the ToL Database are stored in files on your computer, so you can work on your ToL pages even if you don't have a network connection. However, some options like uploading and previewing will not be available when you are offline.

It is good practice to upload your changes to the ToL Database whenever you have a network connection. This will create a backup of your work on the ToL server. The files for a given branch will remain on your computer until you ask for this branch to be checked back in.

message.name: LOCAL_FILES_TOOLTIP_NO_CONN
message.text:
You currently don't have a network connection, so you can only work on branches that you have previously downloaded from the ToL Database. In order to access one of these branches, double-click on it in the list above. If the Local files list is empty, you need to establish a network connection, so you can download a branch to work on.

The Download from server panel and the Upload, preview, submit panel cannot be used when there isn't a network connection, because all the options available in these panels require immediate communication with the ToL Database. If you want to do any downloading, uploading, previewing, or submitting, please establish a network connection, and then restart TreeGrow.

Note: Branches you have downloaded from the ToL Database are stored in files on your computer, so you can work on your ToL pages even if you don't have a network connection. However, some options like uploading and previewing will not be available when you are offline.

message.name: LOST_CONNECTION_CHECKIN
message.text:
145. Your connection to the ToL server appears to have died during checkin.
Please make sure you have a connection to the internet and restart the application.

message.name: LOST_CONNECTION_GENERIC
message.text:
146. Your connection to the ToL server appears to have died during $%operation%$.
Please make sure you have a connection to the internet and restart the application.

message.name: LOST_CONNECTION_MIDSTREAM_DOWNLOAD
message.text:
147. Your connection to the ToL server appears to have died during the download.
Please go to the Download From Server Panel of the TreeGrow Manager, and try to download again.
Don't worry if the server tells you that the branch is already checked out to you.
You can proceed safely with the download.

message.name: LOST_CONNECTION_UPLOAD
message.text:
148. Your connection to the ToL server appears to have died during the upload.
Your changes may not have been received by the ToL Database.
Please try uploading again.

message.name: MENU_TOOLTIP
message.text: In this column enter the text you want to use to identify the accessory page in the Extras menu of the branch or leaf page to which the accessory page is attached.

message.name: MOVE_PAGE_DELETE_ACCPAGE
message.text:
149. If you move this page to the selected target,
the link to the $%page%$ accessory page will be removed,
because you can only link to accessory pages that are attached to containing groups.
Do you wish to continue?

message.name: MOVE_RECYCLE
message.text:
150. Move to the recycle bin.
Contact treegrow@tolweb.org if you need assistance in recovering data.

message.name: MOVING_RECYCLE_BIN
message.text:
151. Moving to recycle bin.
Contact treegrow@tolweb.org if you need assistance in recovering data.

message.name: NAMES_TOOLTIP_NOPAGE
message.text:
When naming nodes in the tree, you will usually want to use the valid, scientific name for the group. However, in the case of prominent groups that have widely used, unequivocal common names (e.g., Green Plants or Terrestrial Vertebrates), using this common name as the node name may also be appropriate.

Please don't use any HTML codes in the Name field. They will mess up taxon searches.

Always use the most specific scientific name available for the group at hand; i. e., in the case of monotypic families or genera, use the name of the species, NOT the name of the genus or family, as the node name.

You can enter additional names for the group (synonyms, higher taxonomic categories, common names) into the Other Names list. All the names in the Other Names list will be used to guide visitors to this node in taxon search results.

Note that selecting Preferred Labels (the check box in the column with the label icon) and Important Other Names (the check box in the column with the ! icon) usually has an effect on ToL page display only if a node has a page attached to it. There is one exception to this: when the containing group of an internal node has a taxon list displayed rather than a tree, the Preferred Label will be printed along with the node name, and the node name will be indented with respect to the Preferred Label, e.g.: Monotypicfamiliidae (the Preferred Labels)     Monotypicfamilia monotypicus (the node name)

Authority data and descriptions will currently be printed only if a node has a page attached to it.

message.name: NAMES_TOOLTIP_PAGE
message.text:
When naming nodes in the tree, you will usually want to use the valid, scientific name for the group. However, in the case of prominent groups that have widely used, unequivocal common names (e.g., Green Plants or Terrestrial Vertebrates), using this common name as the node name may also be appropriate.

Please don't use any HTML codes in the Name field. They will mess up taxon searches.

Always use the most specific scientific name available for the group at hand; i. e., in the case of monotypic families or genera, use the name of the species, NOT the name of the genus or family, as the node name. If you would prefer to have the name of a higher taxonomic category listed as the name of the group on Tree of Life pages, you can achieve this by entering that name in the Other Names list below and then selecting it as a Preferred Label (the check box in the column with the label icon).

You can enter additional names for the group (synonyms, higher taxonomic categories, common names) into the Other Names list. All the names in the Other Names list will be used to guide visitors to the page for this node in taxon search results. Also, you can designate one or more of the Other Names as Important Other Names by checking the check box in the column with the ! icon. Important Other Names will be printed as subtitles on ToL pages.

Check the Page Title Preview below to see how the data you enter in this panel will affect the title array on the ToL page attached to this node. You can enter authority data for any of the names you provide. You need to select the display authority box in order for these data to show up in the title array of your ToL pages.

Anything you enter in the Description field will be printed as a comment after the taxon name on the page of the containing group. So keep it short!

message.name: NAME_REQUIRED
message.text: <html> 152. This node has a page, so it must also have a name.</html>

message.name: NEW_NODES_NO_CUSTOM_DELIMITER
message.text: <html> 153. You have selected to use a custom delimiter, but you haven't entered a delimiter to use. Please type the character that separates your entries in the 'Other' text box.</html>

message.name: NEW_NODES_NO_NAMES
message.text: <html> 154. Please enter names for the new nodes to be added, or click on Cancel.</html>

message.name: NEW_NODES_NO_NAMES_OR_NUMBERS
message.text: <html> 155. Please enter the number of nodes to add or the names of the nodes you wish to add.</html>

message.name: NEW_NODES_NO_NUMBER
message.text: <html> 156. Please enter the number of nodes to add, or click on Cancel.</html>

message.name: NEW_VERSION_DOWNLOAD_STATUS
message.text: <html> 157. Downloading a new version of TreeGrow: </html>

message.name: NEW_VERSION_TO_DOWNLOAD
message.text:
158. There is a new version of TreeGrow available.
It's best to update to this new version before continuing work.
The download will be done automatically, and it will only take a couple of minutes.
Do you want to go ahead and update to the new version?

message.name: NEW_VERSION_XML_CHANGES_REQUIRED
message.text:
159. There is a new version of TreeGrow available.
This version has revisions to the XML structure used by the application,
so it won't be able to upload any of the files you have currently downloaded.
In order to be able to upgrade TreeGrow,
you should upload all your changes and then check in all the branches you have downloaded.
Once you have done this, no files will be listed in the Local Files panel of the TreeGrow Manager.
The next time you start TreeGrow,
you will then have the opportunity to start an automatic upgrade.
After TreeGrow is upgraded, you can download your branch(es) again.

message.name: NODE_HAS_PAGE
message.text:
160. You cannot delete a node that has a page attached to it.
In order to be able to delete this node, you first need to delete the page.
You can do this by opening the Node Data Window,
and then selecting Remove Page from the Node menu.

message.name: NODE_IMAGES_TOOLTIP
message.text:
This panel shows you all the images that are attached to this node. You can add additional images to the node using the Add button below the Node Images list, and you can remove images from this node by using the Delete button. Note that removing an image from a node will not delete it from the ToL database. The image just won't be attached to this node anymore.

You can edit data for an image either here or in the Images Window (accessible from the Window menu), which provides an overview of all the images that are either attached to a node included in the current download or used on a page attached to a node included in the current download.

When adding new images to the ToL Database, we ask that you attach them to the most specific node possible; i.e., if you have an image of a specimen of a certain species and the node for this species is represented in the ToL database, you should attach it to the species node, even if you are going to use the image as a title illustration on the branch page for the order or the family. This means that many ToL images will not be attached to a given node, although they may be used as illustrations on a page attached to this node.

Why are we handling image attachments in this way? It is our goal to impose phylogenetic structure upon the ToL image collection, so that we can query the ToL image database for images attached to a particular set of nodes; e.g., we could ask for all the images that are attached to the Tyrannosauridae node and its descendants. If an image of a Tyrannosaurus was attached to the Dinosauria page, it wouldn't get picked up in such a query.

Fleshing out image data and developing the phylogenetic structure of the ToL image database will long be a work in progress. Since the ToL started out without any data associated with image files, we still have much data entry work to do, and we would appreciate your help in entering data for your own images. For the time being, we have attached most images to the nodes of the pages they are attached to (we could easily do this automatically), and we have entered image data (harvested from custom captions) for most of the ToL title illustrations.

message.name: NODE_IS_LOCKED
message.text:
161. $%name%$ was checked out by $%username%$ at $%datetime%$.
You won't be able to download it until it is checked back in.

message.name: NODE_IS_SUBMITTED
message.text:
162. $%name%$ has been submitted for publication by $%username%$ at $%datetime%$.
It cannot be downloaded until it is released by the editor.

message.name: NOID
message.text: 163. Can't find that username. Please check your typing or contact treegrow@tolweb.org if you continue having problems.

message.name: NO_PRIVILEGES_NEW_NODE
message.text: 254. You cannot assign privileges to a node that doesn't exist in the database. Please upload your tree and try again.

message.name: NOT_CHKD_OUT
message.text: 164. This branch is available for download.

message.name: NO_CONNECTION_INCOMPLETE_LIST
message.text:
165. You currently do not have a connection to the ToL server;
therefore, you can only work on files you have downloaded to your computer.
These files are listed in the Local Files panel of TreeGrow Manager.
If you want to do any downloading, uploading, previewing, or submitting,
please establish a network connection.

message.name: NO_CONNECTION_LOCAL_NODES_ONLY
message.text:
166. You currently do not have a network connection,
so you are limited to attaching objects to nodes included in your current download.

message.name: NO_CONNECTION_NO_BATCHES
message.text:
167. You currently do not have a connection to the ToL server.
If you want to do any downloading, uploading, previewing, or submitting,
please establish a network connection.

message.name: NO_FILE_GIVEN_LOC
message.text: <html> 168. File not present in specified location.</html>

message.name: NO_ID
message.text:
169. Can't find that username.
Please check your typing.
Contact treegrow@tolweb.org if you continue having problems.

message.name: NO_NET_CONNECTION
message.text: <html> 170. Sorry could not connect to the ToL server.</html>

message.name: NO_PERMISSIONS
message.text:
171. Your download privileges do not include the selected node.
You can contact treegrow@tolweb.org to request a review of your privileges.

message.name: NO_PRIVILEGES
message.text:
171. Your download privileges do not include the selected node.
You can contact treegrow@tolweb.org to request a review of your privileges.

message.name: NO_RECORD_FOUND
message.text:
172. No matching record found.
Please check your spelling.

message.name: NO_UPLOADABLE_CHANGES
message.text: <html> 173. There haven't been any changes since the last upload.</html>

message.name: OVERWRITE_PAGE
message.text:
174. The target node has a page.
Do you want to overwrite it?

message.name: PAGE_AUTHORS_TOOLTIP
message.text:
Click on the Add button and select the name of a contributor from the contributors list.

In order for contributors to be available for selection, they first need to be added to the Contributors Pool for this branch. You can do this in the Contributors Window, which is availabe from the Window menu.

message.name: PAGE_ON_A_DESCENDANT
message.text: <html> 175. This group cannot be deleted because at least one of its subgroups ($%node%$) has a page.</html>

message.name: PASSWORD_REQUIRED
message.text: 176. Please enter your password.

message.name: PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MANAGER
message.text: <html> 177. Please enter your username and password.</html>

message.name: PREFERENCES_SUCCESS
message.text: <html> 178. Your preferences have been changed.</html>

message.name: PREVIEW_NO_UPLOAD
message.text: <html> 179. Preview, don't upload.</html>

message.name: PREVIEW_TOOLTIP
message.text:
In order to get a preview of what your ToL pages will look like, you need to upload
your changes to the ToL server. TreeGrow will then present you with a window
that gives you the option to Preview changes in browser. If you decide to do so,
your default browser will launch and load the basal page of the downloaded branch
in the ToL Development Site.

The ToL Development Site is now password-protected. Please use the following to gain access:

User ID: ToL
password: develop

message.name: PROBLEMS_CHECKING_OUT
message.text:
180. In order to edit these data, you have to check them out from the ToL Database.
(Image and Contributor data are checked out independently of ToL branches).
TreeGrow was unable to complete the checkout, most likely because you are not connected to the network.
Please establish a network connection, and then try again.
If the problem persists, contact treegrow@tolweb.org for assistance.

message.name: PROBLEMS_SEARCHING
message.text: <html>There was a problem searching the database. Any matches you have found are local nodes. You may want to try your search again.</html>

message.name: PROBLEM_PUSHING_APPROVAL
message.text: There was a problem pushing the changes to the approval database. Please contact Katja.

message.name: PROBLEM_PUSHING_PUBLIC
message.text: 182. There was a problem publishing the branch. Please contact treegrow@tolweb.org for assistance.

message.name: PROBLEM_REVERT
message.text: 183. There was a problem undoing the last upload. Please contact treegrow@tolweb.org for assistance.

message.name: PROBLEM_REVERT_ALL
message.text: 184. There was a problem reverting. Please contact treegrow@tolweb.org for assistance.

message.name: PROBLEM_REVERT_APPROVAL
message.text: 185. There was a problem reverting the approval database. Please contact treegrow@tolweb.org for assistance.

message.name: REFERENCES_TOOLTIP
message.text:
Please separate your references with carriage returns. On ToL pages, each entry will be formatted into a paragraph with a hanging indent, so do not use carriage returns within a reference.

Please do not use paragraph codes or any other HTML markup in the References text field. This is likely to cause problems in the future. While the ToL references are currently stored as plain text, we are planning to implement a more powerful reference management system which will allow us to link to other databases providing services such as abstracts and full text delivery.

message.name: REVERT_IS_DANGEROUS
message.text:
186. Reverting will result in the loss of all related work.
Is this really what you want to do?

message.name: REVERT_PUBLIC_SUCCESS
message.text: <html 187. $%group%$ reverted to the public version.</html>

message.name: ROOT_EXIST_DOWNLOAD
message.text:
188. You may already have this node downloaded in another branch.
Do you still want to download?

message.name: SAME_NODENAME_QRY
message.text:
189. There is more than one node with name $%name%$ in your tree.
Is that what you want?

message.name: SERVER_PROBLEMS
message.text: 190. There was a problem communicating with the server. Quitting and restarting the application may help.

message.name: SHOW_TOOLTIP
message.text: Check the box in the Show column if you want the link to the accessory page to be shown in the Extras menu of the branch or leaf page that the accessory page is attached to. If there are very many accessory pages attached to a node, you may not want to have all of them listed in the Extras menu. Instead, you can create a listed accessory page with links to additional, excluded accessory pages.

message.name: ST_CANT_COLLAPSE
message.text: 191. Cannot collapse nodes that have pages attached to them.

message.name: SUBMIT_ERROR
message.text:
228. There was a problem submitting the branch for publication.
Try restarting the application, and make sure you have a network connection.
If the problem persists, contact treegrow@tolweb.org for assistance.

message.name: SUBMIT_NO_UPLOAD
message.text: <html> 229. Submit, don't upload. Toss recent changes.</html>

message.name: SUBMIT_SUCCESS
message.text: <html> 230. $%group%$ submitted for publication. Thank you!</html>

message.name: SUBMIT_TAKE_AWHILE
message.text:
231. The Submit process may take a few minutes.
When it is completed, another window will open to confirm your submission.

message.name: SUBTREE_CHECKED_OUT
message.text: <html> 232. The node you are trying to download is checked out by $%user%$.</html>

message.name: SUBTREE_DOWNLOAD_REQUIRED
message.text:
233. You need to download the subtree for this node in order to be able to add subgroups.
Do you want to start the download?

message.name: TEXTSECTIONS_HTML_TOOLTIP
message.text: Please use HTML to format your text. If you need instructions, please have a look at the All the HTML You Will Likely Need page in the ToL Contributors Documentation.

message.name: TEXTSECTIONS_TOOLTIP
message.text:
Use the Add button to create new custom text sections. Use the Delete button to get rid of sections. Standard ToL page sections are shown in blue. You cannot delete those.

Introduction and Characteristics are always the two first sections on a page. The order of the other text sections can be changed by dragging the numbers in the column to the left.

message.name: THREAD_ERROR
message.text: Please contact treegrow@tolweb.org for assistance.

message.name: TITLE_ILLUSTRATIONS_TOOLTIP
message.text: This panel lets you select images as title illustrations for your ToL page. In order for images to be available for selection, they first need to be added to the Images Pool for this branch. You can do this in the Images Window, which is available from the Window menu.

message.name: TOO_MANY_RECORDS
message.text:
235. Too many records found.
Please provide more information to narrow your search.

message.name: TREEGROW_CLOSING
message.text:
TreeGrow is closing now. Your changes have been saved
to a file on your computer. When you want to resume work
on this branch, you can access the associated file in the
Local Files panel of the TreeGrow Manager.

message.name: TREE_FRAME_TOOLTIP
message.text:
The Tree Window lets you create and modify the structure of your branch of the Tree of Life. In addition, it provides a number of tools for the management of objects that are attached to the nodes in your the tree.

Moving your mouse over a toolbar button will give you a hint for the function of that tool. Some tools will have alternative functions when the modifier key (Mac:option, Linux:ctrl, Windows:alt) is held down.

In order to edit objects attached to nodes you must first open the Node Data Window for that node using the Open Node Data Window tool (the button with the little pencil on the blue rectangle).

Note that when you close the Tree Window, you are automatically closing the file for the current branch.

message.name: UNDO_LAST_ERROR
message.text:
236. There was a problem undoing the last upload.
Try restarting the application, and make sure you have a network connection.
If the problem persists, contact treegrow@tolweb.org for assistance.

message.name: UNDO_LAST_SUCCESSFUL
message.text: <html> 237. $%group$% reverted to the version before the last upload.</html>

message.name: UNUP_CHNG_EXIST_DOWNLOAD
message.text:
238. It looks like you have another copy of this branch on another computer.
It's safe to proceed, if you know that the most up to date version is on the server.
What do you want to do?

message.name: UPLOAD_TO_PREVIEW
message.text:
300. This page does not currently exist on the server.
In order to preview it you must do an upload.
Would you lie to upload now?

message.name: UPLOAD_BEFORE_CHECKIN
message.text: 239. This file contains changes which have not yet been uploaded. These changes will be lost unless you upload them prior to checking in. What do you want to do?

message.name: UPLOAD_BEFORE_CHECKIN_SUBTREE
message.text:
240. There are changes in this subtree which have not yet been uploaded.
These changes will be lost unless you upload them prior to checking in.
Do you want to upload?

message.name: UPLOAD_BEFORE_PREVIEW
message.text: <html> 241. Do you want to upload your changes before previewing?</html>

message.name: UPLOAD_FILE_AND_CHECKIN
message.text: 242. Upload the file and check it in

message.name: UPLOAD_FILE_AND_KEEP
message.text: 243. Upload the file, but keep it checked out.

message.name: UPLOAD_SUCCESS
message.text: <html> 244. Changes for $%group%$ have been uploaded.</html>

message.name: UPLOAD_SUCCESS_DOWNLOAD_FAILURE
message.text: There was a problem reading the response of your upload from the server. Please contact Katja.

message.name: UPLOAD_THEN_CHECKIN
message.text: 245. Upload changes, then check in the branch.

message.name: UPLOAD_THEN_PREVIEW
message.text: 246. Upload changes, then preview on server.

message.name: UPLOAD_THEN_SUBMIT
message.text: 247. Upload changes, then submit for publication.

message.name: UPLOAD_TO_SUBMIT
message.text: 248. This branch contains changes which have not yet been uploaded. These changes will be lost unless you upload them prior to checking in. What do you want to do?

message.name: U_AT_ROOT_FILE_EXISTS
message.text: 249. You already checked out this branch on $%date%$, and associated files have been saved on your computer. You can access these files in the Local Files panel of TreeGrow Manager. Proceeding with the download now will revert the branch to the version that's currently on the ToL server.

message.name: U_AT_ROOT_NO_FILE
message.text: 250. Our records show that you checked out this branch on $%date%$, but associated files cannot be found on this computer. If you are sure that you don't have a newer version on another computer, it's safe to download the current version from the ToL server.

message.name: VALID_DEPTH
message.text: <html> 251. Please enter a number between 1 and 5 in the depth field.</html>

message.name: WHICH_NODE_TO_COLLAPSE
message.text:
252. In order to do this, we need to collapse a node.
You can collapse either the containing node or the sister node. Which would you prefer to collapse?

message.name: WRITEASLIST_TOOLTIP
message.text: <html> You can use these buttons to change the indentation pattern of the taxon list. Note that descendants will always be indented to the right of their parent nodes. You will only be able to modify the relative depth of indentations.

message.name: WRONG_PASSWORD
message.text: 253. That was the wrong password. Please check your typing. If you continue having problems, contact treegrow@tolweb.org for assistance.

message.name: NO_CONTACT_NO_EMAIL
message.text:
This contributor cannot be selected as a correspondent since they have the "Do not print email"
option selected. If you wish to mark this contributor as the correspondent, please uncheck
this option.

message.name: EXTINCT_PARENT
message.text: <html> You cannot unmark this node as extinct since its parent is extinct.

message.name: UPLOAD_SUCCESS
message.text:
Upload Successful

The ToL Development Site is now password-protected. Please use the following to gain access:

User Id: ToL
Password: develop

message.name: ADD_IMAGE_WINDOW_TOOLTIP
message.text: You can add additional images (from your desktop or the ToL database) to the Image Pool using the Add button. Any images you add will remain in this Image Pool as long as you have the current branch downloaded. However, when you check in the branch, the Image Pool will be reset to contain only images that are attached to nodes and/or pages of a given branch.

message.name: EDIT_IMAGE_DATA_TOOLTIP
message.text:
In order to edit image data, you first need to check them out from the ToL database by clicking on the Edit image data button (you need a network connection to do this). When you are done editing image data, please check them back in.

Fleshing out image data will long be a work in progress. Since the ToL started out without any data associated with image files, we still have much data entry work to do, and we would appreciate your help in entering data for your own images. For the time being, we have entered image data (harvested from custom captions) for most of the ToL title illustrations.

Currently, you will be able to edit image data for any image attached to a node within your realm of authority. However, we ask that you please not edit the data for other people's images without their explicit permission. It is our goal to soon implement a more sophisticated system restricting the editing of image data to copyright owners and/or image contributors, and allowing others to just add notes in a special field.
